website_summaries.verdict: Coffee tinkerers will love the Breville Precision Brewer's impressive level of control, but it's overkill for most drip drinkers.
pros: The Breville Precision Brewer brews coffee quickly and with superb consistency
It lets you control water temperature, flow rate and presoak time
It makes cold brew automatically and without special filters
It accepts both cone and flat-bottom filters
cons: You need to buy an extra accessory to best use its pour-over mode

customer_reviews.title: This model number is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I like this brewer but it is listed as a BDC450 and that would include the single pour over adapter but it is not that model. You need to buy it for $50. The seller needs to update this listing so it is correct.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself of a Breville fanboy— so when I spotted this product and went through the reviews, I had to have it. The brewer does not disappoint. I’ve read a few reviews of out of the box issues, however, Breville seems to take care of people that have the issue. First few pots of coffee have turned out great. It basically replicates the pour over process. Do yourself a favor each morning and enjoy a cup from this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Norton

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: We needed to replace a Bonavita coffee maker that had an insulated glass carafe that broke so after reading all the different brand reviews, we bought this Breville. I set it on the Strong setting but unfortunately, the coffee is weak by comparison (using the same water to grind proportion) and worse, it's not quite hot. It's more than lukewarm, but once you've added cream, you're close. Also the carafe doesn't keep the heat in nearly as well as our former brand. I'm disappointed. If I could replace the old Bonavita glass carafe, I would.
customer_reviews.author: JMcL

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, pump problems after 1.5 years of use, not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately, you want a great cup of coffee from a reliable maker you can count on and then you can justify the price tag. Unfortunately, you do not get the reliability here. We followed the necessary maintenance and on 2019 Thanksgiving morning, it’s only brewed a half a pot. We thought it odd because we had just done a descaling. After numerous rounds of descaling we never made it flow threw the entire basin to achieve a full pot. It’s loud and vibrates and seems as though the water pump is malfunctioning. After researching numerous brands, we thought we had found a winner. We were wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Moss&Ivy

customer_reviews.title: disappointing all around, terrible value
customer_reviews.text: I was really diappointed with this coffee maker. I had problems with the programming from the start, the display kept telling me to fill the water reservoir when it was already full. reservoir lid is fragile. reservoir has a little pocket that holds water even when the brew cycle is over, very poorly thought out. go with the technivorm and be done, its the best coffee maker you can find.
customer_reviews.author: Yas

customer_reviews.title: Weak tasting and cold coffee
customer_reviews.text: I drink a ton of coffee and have used tons of machines. For $300, this doesn't do it. It's well made, heavy metal, good weight; but it fails to live up to the hype. The water shower doesn't soak all grounds. You'll end up wasting more grounds than making coffee. The Gold setting in particular made a flavored water. I'm not sure how this machine got the reviews for making great tasting coffee. Lastly, the coffee temp is low. Highly recommend not purchasing this. Breville fell short on this one.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine but has a number of irritating features
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this coffee maker but unfortunately its flaws/shortcomings are irritating. 1. The coffee doesn't stay hot in the carafe because the plate does not keep the coffee hot. 2. It often drips onto the plate when you take out the carafe. 3. After it finishes its cycle water still remains in the well and you have to manually pour it out. 4. The flow from the carafe is very slow so you have to remove the cap in order to pour the coffee into a mug/cup. One final comment. I've also decided that I prefer a glass carafe so I'm switching back to the Moccamaster!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Breville is 100% waste of time, money and effort
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker is 100% junk. Less than 2 months in and it quit working. It will not drain water from tank. Worst $300.00 plus I’ve ever spent. Buy any other coffee maker. Forget product support. Breville has a one hour wait time. They’ll call you back. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Savage

customer_reviews.title: Price Change
customer_reviews.text: So I researched and found the perfect coffee maker at what seemed a high price. I guess it was high because I searched far and near and couldn't find it listed anywhere cheaper. No coupons or discounts allowed. :<( So I opted and bought it at $299 which showed a mark down. Well, WOW, now. It's $199. So just shoot me; who would have known; another $100 off?
customer_reviews.author: Peter Errichiello

customer_reviews.title: No more BREVILL for me
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous for 3 months. Then water will not distribute evenly over grounds. Constantly throwing away pot after pot of Peets great coffee along with water I have to buy for this machine. No help from amazon. Tell me too bad for you can not return. No help from brevill. I will say Brevill makes best tasting coffee when they work. Second Brevill for me first was grind and brew and boy oh boy such a problem. Now this one mechanically both a problem. Anyone have an answer to my problem lmk.
customer_reviews.author: carlique

customer_reviews.title: Water tank does not completely drain
customer_reviews.text: One would expect when purchasing a high end coffee maker such as this that a simple function of purging the water tank after each brew cycle would be a no brainer. To my shock and surprise, this high end coffee brewer leaves approximately 1 inch of standing water in the water tank at the end of the cycle. This, in and of itself, was the basis for me to return it. Standing water in the bottom of a tank represents a sanitary health concern and should never have been allowed to be a feature of this unit. Bottom line, serious design flaw and no evidence that the manufacturer wishes to resolve it.
customer_reviews.author: larryof_oc

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I read so many reviews, I almost didn't buy a new coffee maker. I wanted something that would last and make good coffee at a semi-reasonable price. This coffee maker was slightly more than what I wanted to pay, but we've replaced our cuisinart maker 3x in 5 years. Investing a little more now, I'm hoping this one lasts longer. We got one with a thermal carafe as to eliminate the need to a heat plate. I really couldn't be happier. I have access to Starbucks and The Roastery at my work and my organic Camerons coffee taste better than both of theirs. It's very very hot and never bitter. Best coffee purchase yet
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd Breville
customer_reviews.text: After a series of other coffee makers, I found this Breville a fe years back, and was thrilled with the delicious coffee, ease of use and how it looked on my kitchen counter. When the pump died recently, there was no shopping around other than to order another one. This Amazon seller was between $60 and $100 less than anyone else for the same product. Great deal! If you're in the market for a higher-end coffee maker, consider this Breville. If you're going to order it, go with this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Pat In NYC

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brewer for roughly two months, I think. I have zero complaints at this time. I replaced a Capresso brewer that I owned for 10 years and I think the coffee this brews is at least up to the standard of the Capresso. Some complain about the brewer's volume, but my bedroom is right next to my kitchen and I don't hear it when it kicks on in the morning. The insulated pot keeps it hot all day long. And the multiple settings are fun to tinker with.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred A. Egenhofer

customer_reviews.title: Better than what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this coffee maker is pricey, but it was worth it. I was surprised that I could actually taste the difference in my first cup of coffee brewed. It is easy to use, but I would recommend running through the instructions for the different settings, etc. This is a great machine if you are ready to make a little investment in your daily home coffee habit! Hope to have it a long time--the only drawback is that it's noisy when brewing (think Keurig on steroids)!
customer_reviews.author: back40ranch

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with quality!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit May 22, and by Sept 3rd, stopped working. I was impressed with the flavor / quality of the coffee while it worked - which is why I gave this 2 stars. As per Mfg. recommendations, I descaled the unit when it prompted me to do so. All maintenance was performed, and now it stopped pumping water out from the hopper. I paid for what I thought would be a coffee maker that would last years, I guess not. Now I will need to go to Mfg. for repairs. My opinion, this is just not worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: K. Guest

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for a little over a week now, and I love it. So far I have made smaller amounts, so am only using the cone filter, and just the "Gold" setting, but I can honestly say this is the best coffee I have ever made at home. My Keurig sits a few feet away, with very little to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Started leaking just after Amazon Return date lapsed
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for the first month. Good flavor, easy to use. It takes a little more coffee than our old Mr. Coffee to get the flavor we like, but other wise fine. BUT, it started leaking from the top - the valve where the pot goes in - after about a month. Leaks every day, all over the stand and the pot gets leaked coffee on anything you set it on. No happy with this given the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not functioning Correctly after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker has some neat settings that allow you to brew your best cup of coffee but today it stopped working after 4 months of use. I bought this in January and it is now May. A coffee pot that costs nearly $300 aught to work for several years without problem. I am appalled that this expensive coffee maker is not functioning today. Would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Makes Excellent Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is the best coffee maker we have purchased. I like that I can control the bloom time (initial hot water to dampen the grounds), temperature and other things. It makes great coffee. I re-warm the carafe with hot tap water prior to brewing and the carafe then stays hot longer than an hour. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Carla

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Coffee
customer_reviews.text: I live at a high altitude (2600m) and this machine allows me to dial in settings to get the best extraction of the coffee possible even with the low boiling point. I have been using it for a month and it has never failed. I have used both the cone and the basket with good results for both, but I think the cone is better when not making a huge quantity of coffee. One of the features I like best is the single cup feature. IT fill my travel mug directly, so I don't have to dirty up the carafe. I haven't tried the cold brew feature yet, but I am sure it will be good.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Berton Condon

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee I've ever made
customer_reviews.text: Let me say that I LOVE coffee and this was an expensive machine for me. I also got the Breville grinder. I've had it now for a couple of months and love it. The only problem is that I'm now spending twice as much on coffee. Maybe it's because I'm drinking twice as much. Highly recommend that you get the grinder also if you don't have one. Both are very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: David Duty

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected. Easily worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect to like this coffee maker as much as I do. We used to have the manual version of the brazen. It worked well for us for many years. This coffee maker is higher quality, faster brew, more capacity, and overall steps better than the old one that we loved.I don’t consider myself a coffee snob, but I do like a decent cup in the morning. This machine absolutely delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Braun

customer_reviews.title: It arrives broken.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and still bought it. Coffee shop businesses love the flavor of the coffee it produces. But I never got to taste it because the pump was broken on arrival. It was not damaged in shipping, it just did not work. I returned because it was so expensive and I was leary of it after that. Went with the smaller pour over Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coffee leeks during brewing
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine during the first few weeks and then started leeking while brewing. It still makes good coffee, but it takes two to three paper towels to clean up the mess after brewing a full pot. I have cleaned it, made sure the grind was set right and it still makes a mess. I checked with Amazon and i waited too long for a return. I would not recommend this Coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Don't think - just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Coffee machine is amazing. Please note that to get a great flavor you need to have good beans. Even with subpar beans this makes a mean cup. My only gripe with this is the water tank is unremovable so it's just a minor inconvenience to clean. It doesn't bother me but I can see it fustrating some. Beyond that one trivial detail - best coffee machine ever
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Prashad

customer_reviews.title: Super cup of joe!!
customer_reviews.text: This produces the best cup of coffee from a home coffee maker that I've ever had. I have to believe it is because of its processing of blooming the grounds before the brewing begins. Truly better coffee than most coffee stands produce!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Splechter

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the dud Kitchen Aid coffeemaker i bought a year ago. I'm only a week in- But: temperature is fairly hot and it makes a really good cup of coffee. Other positives: access to pour water in resevour is fantastic- user friendly. And when you take top off the carafe : it has a wide mouth making it much easier to clean than others I've had in the past. And its sleek- looks good on my counter! Super happy!
customer_reviews.author: KMD

customer_reviews.title: love the fact that you can brew one CUP of ...
customer_reviews.text: Awsome machine....love the fact that you can brew one CUP of coffee to a carafe and more. Brews amazingly quick too . nice pot .
customer_reviews.author: Guy M.

customer_reviews.title: Smashed into pieces original packaging
customer_reviews.text: Ordered twice both times sent broken first one missing pieces - knob wouldn’t turn Sent replacement-original package taped several places. Box broken torn. Water reservoir smashed - coffee maker bent. Missing pieces
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Ozer

customer_reviews.title: Love this coffee maker so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my other Breville coffee maker...after two weeks it's still putting out a nice flavorful cup of java to start my mornings. No grinder for whole beans on this puppy so if you love fresh ground beans you'll have to buy a grinder...Baratza Virtuoso+
customer_reviews.author: Bullhorns55

customer_reviews.title: Does not warm coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was using the coffee on the "gold" feature, to make optimal coffee and temperatures. I was routinely warming my coffee in the microwave when I would add some milk and just thought the temps were supposed to be a bit cooler based on the setting. I was tired of warming my coffee after making and set the temp up to 208 degrees. The max temperature reached about 160. I have called Brevellie a couple times trying to get ahold of customer service. Long wait times. Last time I waited 40 minutes before a hung up. When I ask them to call back, this is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Grooters

customer_reviews.title: easy great coffee
customer_reviews.text: Does the "Gold Standard " really did make my coffee taste better, if it loses power it all needs to be reset... Odd at this price.
customer_reviews.author: gregory paul beckner

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months of use, the heater failed
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of daily use, the heating element has failed and now the water only gets up to 160 degrees instead of the intended 208. I've been trying to contact their customer service team for an hour and a half now (mid-day on a Friday) and still haven't been able to talk to a human. Very disappointed. This should not happen at this price point. I was generally pleased with the maker before now.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Best drip machine ever!
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! Love all the settings and custom "my brew" where you can tweak settings how you like. Breville customer service is fantastic too! I broke the caraffe by accident shortly after getting this thing & they sent me a replacement free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes exceptional Coffee
customer_reviews.text: This machine makes excellent coffee and is truly customizable. The "bloom" time, brew speed are able to be changed. If all you want is a one button machine but if you are really into coffee, the quality is unbeatable. Unlike many other machines, the carafe has a large opening & is easy to clean. We have other Breville appliances and all are at the top of their class.
customer_reviews.author: Medlaw

customer_reviews.title: Insert Carafe trouble.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return mine. After about a week it kept saying insert carafe, although it was inserted. I could move it around some and it would clear. But not right. Getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mark Francis

customer_reviews.title: Best drip coffee machine I have used
customer_reviews.text: Craft design keeps coffee hot for 6 to 8 hours asks does not leak/drip when pouring. Versatile options with 2 types of filter designs. We prefer the larger one for using full pot and strong setting. Cone shape best for 4 cups or individual. Finally Breville got it right!
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Regret
customer_reviews.text: We have had this machine for less than two months and it has stopped working. It won’t allow any water to flow through it so we cannot clean it. It simply says it’s too hot. Conveniently, it worked long enough so I can no longer return the item. Two months For over $300 is definitely not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mom S

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Brew but Doesn’t Keep Coffee Hot
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the Precision Brewer for eight (8) months. It makes a great cup of coffee and the pour over option is great; however, the carafe does not keep coffee hot. It makes the timer function a complete waste of time as by the time you get to the pot of coffee it is lukewarm. A coffee brewer at this cost should have a high quality carafe.
customer_reviews.author: AlabamaBelle

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffeemaker and well worth the rather high price. Makes the perfect pot every time. Love the menu options too. I believe I've found the perfect machine-finally.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Forbes

customer_reviews.title: No coffee snob but makes a great cup
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, can make 1-12 cups at a time, perfect for me, I wanted better coffee and to get rid of my kuerig, lots of options for the perfect cup
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lawhorn

customer_reviews.title: Coffee not hot!
customer_reviews.text: Coffee temperature is barely hot. Sad, nice looking and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TMG

customer_reviews.title: It makes great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brewer, the coffee tastes great and it's simple to use. I have other Breville appliances, so it integrates nicely on my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Randall J

customer_reviews.title: Good flavor and hot
customer_reviews.text: I always had the Breville with built in Grinder, but cleaning was tedious though I did like the unit. This one while still a Breville is great, so easy to use and clean and no grinder noise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee easy to use
customer_reviews.text: No drip pot, keeps coffee warm for a long time. Can use both cone or basket type filter. Makes wonderfully clear cold brew. Must have the burr grinder with it for best use. Just bought both for my other house. Love them both.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Headed to charity Thrift Store
customer_reviews.text: We were looking forward to adding a coffee maker to the array of Breville products in the kitchen. The coffee maker is a true letdown. After trying multiple settings, we are still unable to get a consistently good pot of coffee. After less than 4 months it's going to be donated and replaced. Truly sorry we wasted money on this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best coffee I've had at home.
customer_reviews.text: This coffeemaker brews the best cup of coffee I can make at home. This includes my french press and Pour-overs take too much time. I've coupled this with the Breville Pro Burr Grinder and together I get coffee I love drinking everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Z.

customer_reviews.title: Next level coffee!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always thought, any old coffee maker works, it’s the coffee that matters. How wrong I was. This coffee maker is fantastic! Easy to use, brings out the flavors the way you like it by how you set it up, and has no heating element to scortch in the pot. Next level coffee at a great price. Get one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not drain all the way
customer_reviews.text: I love the way the coffee tastes. It is easy to use. But the water bin does not drain all the way leaving an inch of water sitting there. This is for a summer home and if u dont absorb the water with a paper towel first then leave a paper towel in it to absorb moisture I am sure mildew will start. I like it. It is also big. I bought it online before seeing it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sollitto

customer_reviews.title: See above
customer_reviews.text: I use the pot on a daily basis and I like the ability to set it for a strong brew. I also like the 12 cup capacity. My only issue is that they need to expand their setup instructions to cover more completely the water hardness test and how you perform that test setting up the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Nowak

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: You can everything in one machine. Taste is really good. Only down side is you cant choose cup size from the menu. It brews for all the water in the tank. Which is not ideal if you like to brew fresh and back to back.
customer_reviews.author: ao

customer_reviews.title: Makes hot coffee and the best coffee ever.
customer_reviews.text: We have bought many different brands of coffee makers, this one is the best ever. We will definitely buy again when we are in need.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Breville makes awesome coffee machines
customer_reviews.text: We love it! Coffee taste great, easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Melony DeVos

customer_reviews.title: Highly revommedndd
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful unit with enough bells and whistles to satisfy the amateur barista!
customer_reviews.author: claudia howard

customer_reviews.title: Not a great value, you can get a better cup of Joe for less.
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised, but the value isn't there. If I were to do it over again, I would go with a quality pour over setup, including a thermal carafe and a temperature controll electric gooseneck kettle. I am a retiree, and the extra time it takes to go that route doesn't brother me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Really the best coffee maker I have ever used. The taste of the coffee is significantly better than any other at-home coffee maker I have ever experienced. Absolutely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: kee3

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I am a dyed in the wool coffee snob! Read as many reviews as possible. The Breville has lived up to the expectations. Produces strong rich coffee without being bitter. Lots of brewing options, but not overly complicated. Was a little skeptical about the price, but I am impressed. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Fish

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy Used
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker is excellent, but because I bought it used unfortunately it came with a very sour flavor - almost as if the previous owner left coffee to sit in the machine for weeks. If I didn’t have that issue, the coffee maker would be easily the best maker I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Please fix the dripping!!
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with the taste of my coffee from this machine but the frustrating part is the cleaning and drip factor. Every time we pull out the carafe the coffee spills from the machine. It’s like clockwork and almost a form of water torture.

customer_reviews.title: Leaves water in the tank

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I do like this coffee maker and recommend to all

customer_reviews.title: Best Coffee Maker I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend the Breville BDC450 Presicion Coffee Maker. It is easy to use and fast. I am very particular about my coffee and the Breville makes excellent coffee. You can adjust how strong you would like your coffee. The best coffee maker I have owned so far. And it looks great!!!

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy built machine & Beautiful to boot!
customer_reviews.text: Great coffeemaker. Great coffee. Love the design & ease of use.

customer_reviews.title: Makes awesome coffee

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Makes the perfect cup of coffee. We use good beans and I now drink my coffee black. No bitterness in the brew because this coffee maker does its job!

customer_reviews.text: Have to read the manual to understand all the options, but it gives you lots of control to get the cup you want. customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: After years of Mr. Coffees and Keurigs and French presses, I finally have coffee at home that tastes great. The flavor of the coffee comes through, without bitterness or acid taste. Although it allows for custom brew settings, I've been happy using the "gold" setting.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E Schroedl

customer_reviews.text: VERY INCONSISTENT OPERATION OF GRINDER WORKING....NOW, IT HAS NOT WORKED FOR THE LAST 5 DAYS. sHOULD HAVE BELIEVED THE FEW PEOPLE THAT C/O THIS PROBLEM AND NOT BOUGHT THIS AWFUL MACHINE!!!

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was attracted to the features of this machine in that it replicated a pour-over coffee and brewed a gold standard cup. However, after cleaning and setting this up discovered that the water wasn't coming out hot enough and way below the described brewing temperature. When the coffee came out of the cone basket with paper filter, it was only 145 degrees. The brew temp should be between 195 and 205 degrees. Plus, as other commenters have mentioned, the water container doesn't empty completely which concerns me from a mold or bacteria perspective. The product's documentation manual states that retention of some water is normal. But why? Anyhow, I am returning this product, it's not worth the price.

Really a pain in the rear! Amazon was kind enough to take it back outside of the return period. I will go back to my Cuisinart or try Capresso, Breville, never again.

product_meta.title: Breville BDC450 Precision Brewer Coffee Maker with Thermal Carafe
product_meta.description:
Brew craft filter coffee automatically.
The world's first 60 oz. drip coffee maker with the precision required to brew craft filter coffee, automatically. Experience your favorite coffee at its best regardless of its origin, age or roast with precise temperature and brewing time.

Automatic Presets and Customizable
With 6 unique brewing modes you can enjoy the perfect, balanced coffee exactly the way you like it. Preset modes include Gold, Fast, Strong, Iced, Cold Brew and My Brew. With My Brew you can fine tune to your taste by adjusting bloom time, flow rate and brewing temp. Or brew pour over using a drip adapter with your favorite pour over device.

Precise & Adjustable Temperature
Great tasting coffee requires precise control over temperature, flow rate and contact time.1. PID Control: Adjustable and precise digital temperature control.2. Pump: Select from 3 different flow rates to optimize contact time.3. Thermo Coil Heating System: delivers water that is more pure than typical brewing systems that use aluminium.

Gold Cup Standard
In Gold Cup preset mode, The Breville Precision Brewer automatically adjusts the water temperature and brew time to meet the standards set by the SCA.

Auto 'Steep and Release' Technology
Breville's patent pending Steep & Release valve holds the water in contact with the coffee when small cup volumes are being brewed without the carafe in place, automatically.

My Brew Setting.
Allows you to customize the parameters like bloom time, brew temperature and flow rate to suit the particular coffee you’re using whether its more floral, fruity, earthy and so on.

Dual Filter Baskets.
Brew any volume of coffee exactly how you like it with the Flat Bottom & Cone Filter baskets, both included.
